Message.Title: Romney/Ryan plan to gut Medicare
Message.Msg: Romney campaign adviser Ed Gillespie was the first to admit they'd target current seniors by raising the eligibility age for Medicare. And now another adviser is admitting that benefits cuts are definitely on the table. If Romney is to achieve its separate goal of reducing overall federal spending to modern lows. But he notes thatRomney could make up the difference elsewhere in the budget or, by “mak[ing] other changes to the Medicare program, such as increased means-testing, that don’t alter the program’s basic structure.” Means testing would apply to people on Medicare now, and it would be a cut to benefits, benefits that retirees earned and paid for through years of work and contributing to the system. That's not the only thing seniors would be losing under Romney/Ryan. If the Affordable Care Act is repealed, with it goes the $4.1 billion seniors and disabled people have saved on prescription drugs. That amounts to an average of $768 in annual savings for Medicare patients, a significant chunk of money for anyone on a fixed income. Also gone with repeal are the free cancer screenings, mammograms and other preventive services. Romney and Ryan are lying, no surprise, when they say that anyone on Medicare now won't see a change in their benefits. They're playing a shell game with American seniors.

Topic.Title: Rmoney to hurricane victim who lost home - "go home, call 211"

Message.Msg: Truly pathetic and insensitive comment by Rmnoney, in his mad dash to La. "It is the height of hypocrisy for Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan to make a pretense of showing sympathy for the victims of Hurricane Isaac when their policies would leave those affected by this disaster stranded and on their own," Sen. HarryReid said in a statement. "This is yet another example of Mitt Romney's extreme right wing agenda, which asks middle class families to sacrifice in order to protect millionaires and billionaires from paying their fair share," Reid said. Rep. Paul Ryan's (R-Wis.) budget, which he said would "gut disaster funding, making it much harder to get aid to our fellow Americans in their time of need."

Message.Title: 'Yes, We Can' Blame GOP For Unemployment
Message.Msg: Can Democrats continue to blame Republicans for high unemployment? Martin O'Malley, chairman of the Democratic Governors Association, says, "Yes, we can." "More jobs were created in the private sector last year alone than in all eight years of George W. Bush. Look, we did not get into the economic problems we did because President Obama was in office for two months. The ground was laid by the bad policies of George W. Bush, and that came at the expense of the growing middle class and giving huge tax breaks to the billionaires." Poll: More blame Bush than Obama Though Bush has been out of office for nearly 3½ years, over 70% percent blame him a “great deal” or “moderate amount” for the nation’s economic woes. Bush’s continued unpopularity — he was recently polled as the least popular living ex-president — will have an impact on the 2012 presidential race, hence his conspicous absence from the RNC.

Topic.Title: Rmoney to hurricane victim who lost home - "go home, call 211"

Message.Msg: How did Rmoney expect a woman who's home was undewater to go home and call 211? “Last night, Democrats tried to move forward on a measure that would have granted the Federal Emergency Management Agency additional funding to help communities devastated by natural disasters,” Sen. Reid said in an advisory. “This ought to be the least political issue going – whether to reach out a helping hand to our friends and neighbors in their time of need,” he continued. “They have lost friends and loved ones. Their homes, businesses and livelihoods have been destroyed by acts of god. Their communities are under water or reduced to rubble. “It’s in our power to help them. But last night Republicans overwhelmingly voted to prevent us from coming to their aid. They prevented us from getting disaster aid to American families and businesses that need it now.” The vote was 53-33, with Republicans uniting against measure that would have brought the aid package to a vote and put a rush on some emergency funds. A 60-vote majority was required to pass it. “They don’t need help next week or next month,” Reid railed. “They need it now. They need it today.”

Message.Title: Republican Masquerade Ball on full tilt last week.
Message.Msg: "The Republicans knocked themselves out producing a convention that was a colossal hoax. They did that for us. Because they care. With exquisite timing, they started caring last Tuesday at 7 p.m., when suddenly the party was chockablock with tender souls in rainbow colors, with strong-minded women and softhearted men, with sentimental rags-to-riches immigrant sagas. We all know Republicans prefer riches-to-riches sagas and rounding up immigrants, if the parasitic scofflaws aren’t sensitive enough to self-deport. That’s why my heart swells to think of the herculean effort the G.O.P. put into pretending its heart bleeds. "Given the president’s lackluster performance and the listless economy, Romney should be killing it. But he’s an odd duck running with a dissimulating striver. Ryan’s harsh stances toward women, the old and the poor are on record, so he set a new standard for gall when he intoned, “The truest measure of any society is how it treats those who cannot defend or care for themselves.” " NYT Dowd Sunday.

Message.Title: The Reason for High Unemployment
Message.Msg: Small business is the engine that drives the economy, no small business is going to hire into the Obamacare mess, repeal this disaster and unemployment goes to 4%. Obamacare Discourages Hiring The law discourages employers from hiring in several ways: ■Businesses with fewer than 50 workers have a strong incentive to maintain this size, which allows them to avoid the mandate to provide government-approved health coverage or face a penalty; ■Businesses with more than 50 workers will see their costs for health coverage rise—they must purchase more expensive government-approved insurance or pay a penalty; and ■Employers face considerable uncertainty about what constitutes qualifying health coverage and what it will cost. They also do not know what the health care market or their health care costs will look like in four years. This makes planning for the future difficult

Message.Title: Boeing forcing it's Engineering workforce to make Striking Decisions
Message.Msg: The very brains of Boeing is about to be tested by Boeing. Boeings refusal to negotiate a new contract an instead simply mandating things with the union is causing an uproar. With about 3 weeks left for ballots to be mailed out - Boeing has yet to put anything on the table that would be considered "negotiated" rather mandated by Boeing and not dealing fairly with the process. Boeing was near death facing bankruptcy when we all tightened up our boot straps and brought this company back. Now we have record airplane orders, new programs being developed including the next generation USAF tanker and Boeing is telling the union that they are needing to remain "competitive" with other companies. Boeing execs continue to get big bonuses and the CEO a 31% pay increase plus stock options is not what I would call sucking it up to remain competitive. I call it swindling pure and simple. Boeing Corporate act just like pirates "take what you can, give nothing back" mentality. I look forward to Oct 7th to either a fair contract or a picket. Personally, I'm ready to walk the line. Many Managers have openly expresssed we should go.

Message.Title: The Democrat Legacy of Failure
Message.Msg: Question: Do you know what % of Americans were in poverty when Lyndon B. Johnson declared a war on poverty, and then proceeded to pass all of the Great Society welfare programs? Answer: It was about 15%. Question: Do you know what the current poverty level is now? Answer: It's 14.3% and rising. Question: Do you know how much America has spent on Great Society welfare programs since Lyndon B. Johnson passed the welfare legislation that was suppose to create utopia? Answer: Google that your self so you'll know where to tell your friends to look. Hint = know what the current American debt is? Virtually every single gov't program and cabinet has failed to do what it promised to do, and cost 4 - 10 times more than originally advertised. When individuals invest in something that doesn't work, they stop throwing the money down the toilet and try something else. When gov't programs fail to deliver, Democrats tell us it's because they need more money and investment. Hence why we've paid 4 - 10 time more than what programs were originally advertised to cost. How stupid are they? Are they truly trying to destroy the country from within? Is their lust for power and buying more votes so great that they are willing to bankrupt the country and future generations? Incredible.

Message.Msg: Obama told CNN today that he does not have time to “network” with others in governmental leadership as he and Michelle “are too busy as parents”. He also tells college students that there should be more money for college education, whatever is needed – even though he borrows like Popeye’s friend Wimpy who often said, “I will gladly pay you on Tuesday.” So we have a President who refuses to participate at the level that is necessary in order to coordinate the business of the many unemployed and fewer employed hundreds of millions of Americans because he is "too busy with his own daughters" and he tells college students that they will have whatever they need in additional funding for their education – even thought there is no money and the students will obviously have to suffer the future overwhelming massive debt. Sounds like what the Devil promised Daniel Webster. Only the Democrats will continue to vote for the Devil no matter what he does.
